newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - Feb 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - Feb 25.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5649. Fax: (822) 727-5666.

- Opposition lawmakers, during a question-and-answer session in the national assembly on Monday, called for reinvestigation into the Hanbo loan scandal and demanded that Kim Hyun-chul, second son of President Kim Young-sam, take the witness stand for a parliamentary hearing.

- Samsung Group officials on Monday said they would freeze wages for managers and above, and place a three percent wage increase cap for all other ordinary employees in return for not laying off workers.
- President Kim Young-sam is expected to issue a special statement at 9.30 a.m.(0030 GMT) about the Hanbo Group loan scandal and controversy surrounding the new labour law.
- The Investing in Korea Service Center, was opened on Monday to provide one-stop services for foreign investors, in line with the government's push to attract investments from overseas.
